page.title: 05Scotton/Northorpe: Education
page.content: 18 children from 2\ upwards go to Scotton Pre-School Playgroup which in term time has 3 morning sessions a week in the village hall, with 2 paid supervisors and a rota of voluntary helpers; fees are 80p a session. A Mother and Toddler Group meets weekly, except in summer. Scotton school closed in 1931; most 5-11 year olds go to Scotter Primary School (transport is provided from Northorpe). Currently at 11+ children may opt for Huntcliff School (11-16 comprehensive) at Kirton Lindsey, or (if they sit the 11+ exam) one of the Gainsborough Schools: Queen Elizabeth's High (grammar 11-18) or Castle Hills (secondary modern 11-16). Most choose Huntcliff, some continuing 16-18 at Scunthorpe. Changes in secondary education in this area appear inevitable. 2 Scotton girls are at present at university.
